macro_markets.query: What are the most important macroeconomic and stock market news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include major index movements, Fed/central bank news, and significant company earnings or announcements.

items.title: Stock Market Sets New Records as Tech Leads Gains
items.summary: The Dow Jones Industrial Average hit a record high of 49,503.38, rising 1.07%, while the S&P 500 gained 0.65% to 6,947.20 and the Nasdaq Composite rose 0.63% to 23,543.55. Technology shares and chip stocks drove the rally amid renewed optimism about artificial intelligence.

items.title: Investors Focus on Jobs Data Ahead of Friday Employment Report
items.summary: Markets are pricing in two Federal Reserve rate cuts for 2026 as investors await the December jobs report on Friday, which will be crucial for assessing the Fed's monetary policy outlook.

items.title: Energy Stocks Surge on Venezuela Oil Sector Developments
items.summary: Chevron climbed 5.1% and Goldman Sachs advanced 3.7% following President Donald Trump's urging of American companies to invest in Venezuela's oil sector, boosting major U.S. oil companies.

items.title: Dollar Edges Higher as Markets Await Economic Data
items.summary: The dollar index rose 0.17% to 98.56 as investors focused on upcoming U.S. economic data that could influence Federal Reserve policy decisions.

items.title: Global Stock Indexes Rise on Technology Strength
items.summary: MSCI's gauge of global stocks rose 0.72% to 1,035.38, while the pan-European STOXX 600 index gained 0.58%, with indexes in Germany and Spain hitting record highs.

crypto_news.query: What are the most significant cryptocurrency and blockchain news from the past 24 hours? Include major price movements, regulatory news, and notable project developments.

items.title: Bitcoin Surges Past $93,000 as Crypto Market Starts 2026 Strong
items.summary: Bitcoin has climbed to $93,735.40 with a market cap of $1.87 trillion and 58.28% market dominance, driven by new-year allocations and geopolitical safe-haven demand. The broader crypto market is experiencing strong gains at the start of 2026.

items.title: Ethereum Gains 10.2% Weekly as Major Altcoins Rally
items.summary: Ethereum has surged to $3,231.96 with a 10.2% weekly gain, reclaiming the $3,000 level. The broader altcoin market, particularly memecoins, has staged a rebound following earlier drawdowns.

items.title: Bitcoin Halving Cycle Concerns Could Limit 2026 Rally Despite Liquidity Gains
items.summary: While liquidity is supporting bitcoin's current rally, analysts at Schwab warn that fears surrounding the halving cycle could constrain upside potential throughout 2026.

items.title: Retail Sentiment Catching Up to Institutional Bitcoin Momentum
items.summary: Coinbase's institutional strategy head John D'Agostino noted that retail investor sentiment is now aligning with institutional momentum that has been building in bitcoin markets.

ai_news.query: What are the most important artificial intelligence and machine learning news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include new model releases, company announcements, research breakthroughs, and industry trends.

items.title: Nvidia Launches Vera Rubin AI Computing Platform at CES 2026
items.summary: Nvidia unveiled the Vera Rubin platform featuring the Rubin GPU, offering five times the AI training compute power of Blackwell, with products available from partners in late 2026. CEO Jensen Huang also announced Alpamayo, an open reasoning AI model family for autonomous vehicles.

items.title: Former Apple Face ID Engineers Launch Lyte Robotics Startup with $107M Funding
items.summary: Lyte AI Inc., founded by ex-Apple engineers, raised $107 million to develop a unified perception platform integrating 4D sensing for enhanced robot spatial awareness and real-time decisions.

items.title: PubMatic Launches AgenticOS for Enterprise Marketing and Advertising
items.summary: PubMatic introduced AgenticOS, embedding agentic AI into programmatic infrastructure to enable faster decision cycles and strategic optimization at scale for large marketing budgets.

items.title: LSU Highlights Next-Generation AI for Smarter Security and Energy Efficiency
items.summary: LSU researchers predict continued AI scaling laws, growth in AI security studies, and advances in neuromorphic computing and TinyML for resource-constrained environments.

items.title: Texas A&M Develops SSPAIN.ai Tool for Sports Sponsorship Predictions
items.summary: SSPAIN.ai uses machine learning on over 5,800 sponsorships to forecast renewals and durations, gaining interest from teams like Texas A&M Athletics and the NFL.

gaming.query: What are the most notable video game and gaming industry news from the past 24 hours? Include game releases, announcements, esports, and industry developments.

items.title: Xbox Game Pass Adds Major January Releases Including Star Wars Outlaws and Resident Evil Village
items.summary: Microsoft has announced multiple surprise Game Pass additions for January 2026, including Star Wars Outlaws (January 13), Resident Evil Village (January 20), Final Fantasy (January 8), and Little Nightmares: Enhanced Edition with 4K/60fps visuals. Several titles became available on January 7 including Atomfall, Warhammer 40,000: Space Marine – Master Crafted Edition, and Lost in Random: The Eternal Die.

items.title: NVIDIA Launches G-SYNC Pulsar Gaming Monitors with Over 1,000 Hz Motion Clarity
items.summary: NVIDIA released new G-SYNC displays featuring Pulsar and Ambient Adaptive Technology on January 7, offering unprecedented motion clarity and stutter-free smoothness. The displays, developed in collaboration with MediaTek, start at $599 and are available from manufacturers including Acer, AOC, ASUS, and MSI.

items.title: VR Studio Cloudhead Games Cuts 70% of Workforce
items.summary: Pistol Whip developer Cloudhead Games announced a 70 percent workforce reduction on January 7, 2026, with CEO Denny Unger sharing the news on Bluesky.

items.title: Meta's Threads Testing In-Chat Basketball Gaming Feature
items.summary: Meta's Twitter-like app Threads is experimenting with a chat-based basketball game featuring pixelated aesthetics, allowing users to compete in direct messages. The feature aligns with Meta's strategy to enhance engagement through gamification and follows Instagram's similar DM gaming launch.

items.title: Games Workshop Announces Warhammer Preview Show for January 16
items.summary: Games Workshop has scheduled a preview show for January 16 at 7:30 PM GMT featuring new announcements for Age of Sigmar, Blood Bowl, Horus Heresy, and Warhammer 40,000.

tech_news.query: What are the most important technology news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include major product launches, company news, and significant tech industry developments. Exclude AI-specific news.

items.title: NVIDIA Launches G-SYNC Pulsar Gaming Monitors with Ambient Adaptive Tech
items.summary: NVIDIA announced G-SYNC Pulsar displays from Acer, AOC, ASUS, and MSI, available starting January 7 at 6AM PT, priced from $599. The tech, developed with MediaTek, offers over 1000 Hz effective motion clarity and includes 63 new G-SYNC Compatible displays like Samsung's 1,040 Hz monitor.

items.title: Intel Unveils Core Ultra Series 3 Processors at CES 2026
items.summary: Intel launched the Core Ultra Series 3 processors, promising up to 15% better performance per watt and 30% better chip density with Intel 18A. The company emphasized U.S. investments and local compute capabilities up to 180 TOPS.

items.title: Qualcomm Showcases Snapdragon X2 Elite and X2 Plus at CES 2026
items.summary: Qualcomm revealed the Snapdragon X2 Elite high-performance chip and more affordable X2 Plus for laptops, building on the success of prior Snapdragon X chips with superior battery life and performance. Upcoming laptops from Lenovo, Asus, and Dell will feature these chips.

items.title: AMD Announces Ryzen 7 9850X3D and Other Chips at CES 2026
items.summary: AMD unveiled the Ryzen 7 9850X3D alongside other new chips that could challenge Intel, as presented in CEO Lisa Su's keynote. The announcements highlight advancements in high-performance computing.

items.title: Samsung Debuts Spatial Signage for Enterprise at CES 2026
items.summary: Samsung introduced glasses-free 3D Spatial Signage, winning a CES Innovation Award in the Enterprise category. The 85-inch slim display enhances shopping experiences with immersive visuals and Samsung VXT for remote content management.

items.title: HP Reveals EliteBoard G1a: Copilot+ PC Built into a Keyboard
items.summary: HP showcased the ultra-slim 12mm EliteBoard G1a keyboard housing an AMD Ryzen AI 300 series chip, built-in speakers, dual mics, and a user-replaceable battery. It supports biometric login options.

items.title: Dolby Vision 2 Support Confirmed for Hisense, TCL, and Philips TVs
items.summary: Hisense, TCL, and Philips announced support for Dolby Vision 2, the next-gen HDR format, in upcoming 2026 TV models debuted at CES.
